Came in at 12:30 on  Sunday and our only options were the all you can eat brunch for $15 or the appetizer/burger menu on the back.

Their other menu was huge, but we couldn't have that until 2pm on a Sunday. Bummer.

The beer list looked awesome and had really great deals (compared to where I live, Chicago) $3.50 for a 12 ounce, that is amazing! And flights of beer....sign me up!

I ordered the boneless buff wings in 3 Alarm. They weren't that hot, but still good. The gorgonzola dip tasted great, but just like blue cheese...so not really sure if it's just me who doesn't know my cheese or what...but whatev.

Service was friendly, mac and cheese pizza was on a pita bread and didn't look that amazing--sadly. I could get better mac n cheese pizza in Chicago--regular crust, too.

Burgers came with choice of friends, apple sauce, or coleslaw. You could substitute for Turkey Burger, Boca, Buffalo for $.50 to $1.00.

I would come back here for dinner if I could and get a different entree and try some beers.

I've been to this Great Dane location a few times, and overall I've been pretty happy with it.  Parking can be an issue, but after that, the same consistent product you'll find at other Great Dane locations.

Most of the time, I end up just there for drinks.  And their beer menu doesn't disappoint.

I've been here twice now. First time, I ordered the Black and Tan Cheddar Burger, which was pretty good. I wouldn't say amazing, as I've had better burgers, but it definitely filled the craving for a burger and fries. On a recent trip, I got the Cajun Chicken sandwich. It was a good sandwich, with tasty spices and seasoning. However, it was TINY. I was shocked at how small the chicken breast was, and that the lettuce and tomato on the sandwich completely overshadowed the chicken. It was one of those sandwiches that you could finish in just a few bites. I had the sandwich with a side of cheddar grits, which were good, more on the dry side, but still good. 

I would recommend coming here if you are in a rush, or come here for the beer. But there are much better places for good American type food in Madison.
Ahi Tuna Salad for the healthy, Brat Bacon Pretzel Burger for the rest of us! Great beer, Great service.

Food was great but they told us 25-30 minute wait and we actually waited an hour and a half. 

While we were waiting, we decided we'd go down and play some pool until we found out it was 7 or 8 dollars (can't remember) just to play one game!

I raise them one star for their stance on the micro beer issue.   People are starting to wake up that we have the power to fight back and fight we will.  Great Dane is doing the absolute right thing.  Thank you Great Dane!

I have been a big fan of The Great Dane and living in between two of them has always been a plus for me. I always suggest coming here whenever someone new comes in to town, the people, beer and food have always been up to par. That being said the last two times I visited the Hilldale establishment I have been very embarrassed  at my suggestion and just plain disappointed that the cooks and waitress had the nerve to serve me grease slop. Both times my guest and I ordered cheese curds and they were completely drenched in oil, soggy and gross. This past time not only were they slightly burnt, slopping in oil, but 6  of them didn't even have cheese in the curd which I assume is because it was cooked so long the cheese came out. It seems to me a new breading or curd is being used, please go back to the original. The other food there is great, but I truly love cheese curds and my appetite has been ruined by the choice to serve me and I would assume other customers In The best words "crap". Please doing something about this Great Dane, because I love giving you my money, but right now that's not going to happen.

This is definitely the least favorite of mine for their locations. Parking is difficult during their busy hours and with the mall and theater nearby, it makes things even more tricky. I do like that the bar is very central in this pub when you walk through the doors.

As always, the food is great and the beer is decent.

It is a local, within walking distance for me, so I have been more than more.

Overall, it is an enjoyable atmosphere (in the bar area).  Sitting is usually available.

Their beer is good....some great....some okay.  They keep a good variety of beers on tap, both seasonal and the regulars.

Food is good....sometime really good....just depends on what you like.  I have tried a couple of items I did not like....pulled pork sandwich is one, but I have items I really like....their green chili, Reubens and Smothered Chicken to name a few.

I have been very fortunate with good service.  Nice place to watch multiple games too.  I will keep coming back for sure.

Went to Sunday Brunch today. Even though it didn't end for another 1.5 hours, and they stopped putting out new food, so many options ran out or got old. The breads dried out and the hollandaise sauce separated. The desserts ran out, and so did the chicken wings and eggs benedict. It was as if the restaurant wasn't even trying and didn't care to have customers.
Our waitress didn't clear our dirty plates or refilled our drinks.
For the quality and selection, not worth $15.  
I would not recommend. There are better options!

I will love the Dane forever, and this is my favorite location.  The food is fantastic--I love substituting for bison burgers.
The burgers are what I order most often, but I also enjoy their "Inner Warmth" stew.  There's something for (almost?) everyone on the menu.
The beer is very good--I especially like their Crop Circle Wheat.
This is a great place to watch a game or hang out with friends; lots of seating options, whether you want it loud and rowdy or an intimate booth (two ends of the restaurant make this easy to sit where you're comfortable).

I love The Great Dane Brewing Co.! I was first introduced by my realtor at the Hilldale location when searching for a home in Madison. Then upon each visit we stopped in just because we new where it was and that the food was good. Now I meet my husband for lunch there and I've taken friends and family. Everything I've had has been delish! The staff has always been friendly and efficient. When I inquired about their IPA beer, the server brought me a sample to taste prior to ordering. The only down side for me was when we went for lunch on a Sunday and were told a flat fee brunch ran until 2p. Only afterward could we order off the menu. But, we will keep going back for sure!

1 1/2 stars rounded up to 2 only because their location is convenient. 

The food is horrendous.  

I want to like this place.  I really do.  But the food has actually taken a turn for the worse lately.  Its really bad.  

The bar feels like a chain, which isnt necessarily bad.  Its clean and service is decent.  Its just the food...oh yeah, and their beer...

Their beer is pretty gross.  I'm still impressed they have two cask conditioned on tap but unfortunately neither is very good.  Overall their beers are way too sweet.  I leave feeling bloated and on a sugar high.  Syrupy if you will.  

If you want to grab one or two and have a quick app then I understand.  I somehow end up there every once-in-a-while.  Unfortunately it keeps getting worse each time.  

I'll probably still go here and there but I'm not happy about it.  Its one of those places...

I've been to this GD Location twice now. First with the man and a friend, and we were all slightly disappointed in the food. My salmon sandwich was WAY too smoky and a touch on the oily side(even for an oily fish). The second time it was with a larger group, and we were led alllll the way into the back to be seated. I had NO idea that this place was so big. The atmosphere is nice, for a pub. Plenty of seating, and as Chris said, the outdoor area is nice. 

But, I was STILL disappointed in my food selection. To me, a dish called "Wisconsin Mac and Cheese" should showcase cheese...not just a plain bechamel sauce and bread crumbs. Don't get me wrong, it was decent pasta...just not what I consider "mac and cheese"... I'd give this place one more shot, I guess.

A brew pub with a local connection, the great badger running back, Ron Dane. Expect huge, football player-sized portions and enough choices that everyone on your big 10 squad could have something different. 

We enjoyed the salmon, Cesar wrap and burgers - all excellent. Service could be a little spiffier butt it seems the restaurant was seating people section by section thus overwhelming the diligent servers who got all their tables at once. 

Will go back for the food, without question.

My favorite location of one of my favorite restaurants! Their food is amazingly delicious. I love every burger I've ever had. The Nakoma Nachos are some of the best I've had and I can never pass up the beer bread and butter. The only thing I've ever gotten from the Dane that I didn't like was calamari, but I got that from the down town location so I don't know if it's different here. I absolutely love the atmosphere. I spent some of my first dates with my boyfriend in a cozy, intimate booth in their front area. He and I come here every year around the time we fell in love with each other. The wait service is always amazing, but I don't usually like their bartenders. My boyfriend and I have gone for pick up last minute which I know isn't the best thing in the world to do, but we always call ahead! The bartender will say it's fine, but when we get there we get turned away even though we get there in time. I haven't been back in about six months because this has happened three times.

*Brunch buffet review only*

Came here for Sunday brunch at around 10:30 A.M. so we missed any potentially big crowds. The service was excellent and we were seated immediately. The buffet fare is extremely varied, including standard breakfast fare (scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, etc) as well as several other stations that had specialty items (like eggs Benedict, chicken and waffles, grits, chowder, Mac N' cheese, taco bar, salad bar, omelet station, roasted meats, pastries, desserts, etc). The vibe was a more upscale buffet on brunch and I enjoyed all of the options. That being said, the food in itself wasn't amazing. While there were plenty of options, nothing stood out, from the fried chicken (wasn't crispy and was a little dry), to quiche to the small smoothie cups there were. It was an overall pleasant atmosphere and experience, but the food in itself did not blow me away. $17 is a decent price for a brunch buffet here, but I couldn't help but feel that I could have paid less for one higher quality brunch instead. I was overall a little disappointed at the quality, though thought the variety of options was decent for a bar/pub-like place.

I really like the Great Dane and it seems that time and location seem to be a factor. We really like to sit Poolside at the Hilldale location because the round booths are super comfy. The past few times Babe and I have been there I've had the Cubano, which I absolutely love! We quite often go for lunch before or after we shop at Metcalfe's depending on the time of year. One of the best reasons to drink here is if you like whiskey, because they tend to be generous with their neat pours. I also really like their pool tables. It does get busy for dinner, but lunch on Saturday is usually an okay bet unless the Badgers are out.

Do not get the Walleye on Friday! Bland, soupy, scary.
Not happy.
Had hoped for better service and review of Friday fish fry, response "Its the greatest, its my favorite fish fry!"

Beer...good!
The wait for the server to take our order and later to get our food was brutal. The cheese curds tasted just like chopped mozzarella sticks. Nothing special overall.

Generic brewpub. I prefer the downtown location but this one is less packed and easier to get to. The menu changes every so often and I like that because variety is the spice of life but some people would rather eat the same thing every time and they would do well to avoid getting attached to anything but the burgers (which nobody should be attached to). Salads are good

Love the place and it's food.
I like the location because it is big and nicely decorated. I like that they can offer different rooms for private events, all of them different sizes.
The staff is really helpful and nice.

I've tried several things over the time, still am a fan of their mashed potatoes and chicken quesadillas if you like it spicy. Of course their different types of beverages, including the beer offering.

Service: 3.5
Food: 3.5
Environment: 1

I had friends came to spend the weekend in Madison with me and they wanted to grab dinner nearby. We went to the Great Dane knowing there wouldn't be too long of a wait. This location has a lot of seating. We waited 2 minutes. Perfect. 

Server was prompt. Our soups and salads came out first. We put in an appetizer and our server forgot to put it in. He ended up not charging us for it. Our food was great. 

I guess the thing that really made the experience not so pleasant was the environment. There was a wall next to us and on the other side was a large family with a bunch of kids that kept telling. We could barely hear ourselves. No one told them to quiet down until right before they left. It was unbearable. 

I've been to their weekend brunch and it's pretty good if you go earlier when everything is fresh. Pricing is good and therebis a good variety. 

Enjoy!

The Great Dane has to be one of my all time favorite Madison restaurants. The food is good, the beer is better and the service and decor just really make you feel like home. 

First lets talk beer. The scotch ale is phenomenal, I can't rave about it enough. It's a smooth, full caramel flavor that would go with any of their amazing burgers. Another that I tried for the first time last night was their fruity beer called serendipity. It was like a cranapple citrus cocktail. It was so fruity that if someone had blind taste tested me with it I would have never guessed it was beer and not a mix drink of sorts, honestly. This would be a perfect option for converting any girl you know who doesn't drink beer because it didn't taste good or that beer is for men over to the good side.

The food is also awesome, classic pub food but much higher quality. The cheese curds are good to start, but I love their artichoke dip. It's served warm in a bread bowl so you can eat apart the soft doughy serving dish after. Next you simply must try their French onion soup. There is so much caramelized chese on that bad boy you could probably not eat anything else and be stuffed. Next the burger, seven ounces of meat smothered in cheese and sauce. I would suggest you upgrade to the pretzel bun, its worth it and you are already not counting any of the calories in this meal so you might as well do this right. I tried the sweet potato tots with this last night and it was just ok, I'll stick with fries in the future.

To be given this smorgasbord of deliciousness you should expect to wait. There's always a wait on weekends and certainly your food doesn't fly out of the kitchen either. But if tasty food and drink is something you are willing to put some time in for, you definitely should do it here.

Went there for a wedding rehearsal dinner and was very impressed! The server was great and handled such a large and demanding group quickly and efficiently. We had a menu of about eight options to choose from and strategically ordered as many different things as we could between the five of us sitting together, and everyone was very happy with what they got. Personally I had the meatloaf which was outstanding; I heard several guests rave about the salmon. To top it off the handcrafted beers were also great--my favorite was the wheat. I don't live in Madison but I would definitely recommend this place to those there.

The Great Dane gets a solid OK. It's consistently OK. It's also open Sunday night - a plus. You can get the burgers with local beef or bison for an up charge. 

We had the special - a Chicken Cordon Bleu (sort of). The ham and cheese were laid on top of a thinly pounded deep fried chicken breast, smothered in a creamy mushroom sauce. It was tasty - but not really a Chicken Cordon Bleu. 

Also had the Chicken Salad sandwich. It came on a croissant. Companion said it could have used grapes or walnuts. 

One of the best sides is the fried plantains. But there are a number of sides to choose from - green beens, apple sauce, cold veggies, and fries. 

The Great Dane is consistent and you can usually get a table in the seat yourself back bar pretty quickly. There is a more formal dining service up front - both seating areas have the same menu.

I really have no idea where to start, I adore this place! Not only is the food usually amazing (a couple of their dishes are just not quite my taste, tho still well done), but the atmosphere is addicting. I've been going here for a number of years and in all that time I think I've only had one instance of poor service. The regular servers are extremely nice and knowledgeable about both their food and beers, so ask your servers to help match your food and drink! I loooove their in house beers (their Black Earth Porter and Emerald Isle Stout has ruined me for most others)! The darker beers can taste a bit salty but I actually enjoy that saltiness. 

I'm always excited for the seasonal menu update that the Great Dane does. It keeps their food fresh and their establishment interesting. They have cozy booths with wonderfully high backs that gives the place a nice intimate feel for a date and allows you to actually hear what your dining companions are saying.

The downside that pops up is that a lot of other people realize how good this place is. So depending on the time you go, there could be a decent waiting time.

I visited Great Dane with some coworkers when I first came to Madison for training. I enjoyed their brew selection so much I returned the next time I was in the area for training. Each time I visited I was seated quickly and the server arrived to the table promptly. The atmosphere is warm due to the normal earth tones and dark wood seen in many pubs, as well as the fireplaces on the premises. There is also a large pool hall, which I still haven't checked out. 

There is a superb variety of tasty craft brew. I liked everything I sampled, the Oktoberfest, Barleywine, and the Stone of Scone Scotch Ale, so it was difficult to make a decision. But that being said, I was completely happy when I finally did decide. Hopefully, I will get to try their Porters and Stout at a later date. 
As for the food, on my first visit I ordered the German Sausage Plate, and on the subsequent visit I ordered the New London Bridge Fish Fry. The sausage was great, however, the garlic mashed potatoes tasted like no salt was added at all. The fish was succulent and fried nicely, however, it also was missing salt. I ordered an appetizer of cheese curds on each occasion, and each time they were delicious. 

So for me, the brew is the star, as it should be since it is a brewery. Therefore, it is primarily the brew that earned the four stars, in addition to the great service. The food is fair, but I think you will definitely be pleased if you are coming in for just brew and an appetizer. For those who are not into brew, a full bar is also available. Stop by and check them out, the great brew is worth it.

The Great Dane is the Cheesecake Factory of Madison, WI. They try to do everything, and they do it a-ok. A few things are actually pretty good, but they can be tough to find through the massive newspaper that is their menu (seriously, its designed like a newspaper). Their in-house beer is decidedly sub-par, and they don't really offer other options, which is a shame in a state so inundated with excellent breweries. 

If you've got your mind set on the Great Dane, and the weather is permitting, head downtown-- the outdoor beer garden is a game-changer.

Hmm, I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place.  I visit this location every few months and am never dissapointed.  They have one of the best decently priced brunches in the area and the service is usually spot on!  I also love how they are alway mixing up the menu; they is always something new to try.  I think my favorite thing about this place though is that they don't hassle you when you want to substitute side dishes.  I usally try to find a way to add plaintains to my dish and I never receive a snarky response or a ridiculous sub fee.  Love it!

If you don't like the Sunday brunch here, you probably just don't like brunch buffets. There is something for everyone, some good, some OK, nothing bad. 

Start with the on-premise-brewed beers on which they made their name. Maybe use one as a chaser for their pretty-good Bloodies. My kids like their house sodas. I've sipped them too. They're good.

The fruit and veggies on the salad bar are fresh and offer a nice contrast to the heavy (but delicious) hash brown casserole, the cooked-to-order omelets, the prime rib, the bacon (yes, of course, bacon!), the sausage, the scrambled eggs (why not get an omelet, though?), the eggs Benedict, the biscuits and the gravy and the pancakes and french toast. 

Full yet? Good, because this is only half of what's here: Pasta, beef tips, noodles, steamed veggies, turkey, dressing and mashed potatoes all await you on the other side of the buffet. It's not all steaming hot, but does heat add flavor? Really? 

The desserts and pastries rest in between, but who has room now? The screens are a little small if you're coming in for the NFL action, so you'll have to luck into or wait for a table by a TV that has your game. Do do doot, do do do doot! Go! Pack! Go!

"The Great Dane" is essentially Madison's version of a "Ruby Tuesdays" except they make their own beer. Unfortunately, I live and work close by so I end up getting suckered into going there more often then I'd like. 
Pro
--outdoor seating!
--fun for watching sports
--local beer, but I think New Glarus and Capitol are much better
Con:
--pricey bar food
--inconsistent service and quality of food
--Loud(it's a bar!)
--service can be VERY slow if it's even a little busy
--a few uncaring, incompetent servers that can ruin your meal

If you feel that you absolutely MUST do "The Dane" experience head over to the downtown location as it's a bit better.
Love this place and all I have to say is two things:  love, love, LOVE their Bloody Mary's, and if you like french onion soup, this is a no-brainer.

While GDP-Hilldale can be considered a scheduling game of "russian roulette" after 5pm, the rewards for getting there at the right time are sometimes worthwhile, provided some insight into specific menu items prevents further "russian roulette" shenanigans.  The menu is a convoluted and often bizarre combination of items that when viewed as a whole, makes one think of the "Tower of Babel" in menu form.  Their signature "sustain-a-burger", now heftily priced at over $10 leaves a satisfying taste and mouth feel.  Unless you are under strict dietary supervision, avoid the warmed vegetable side, which is merely naked vegetables which may have been frozen until their presentation on your table.  On other occasions, items have been hit or miss, mainly due to a wide variation of temperatures when served, and on rare occasion, the possibility of a "reheating".  With the price points of entrees ranging between $12-$20, such experiments are unwelcome.  Those on a budget can get away with a cup of soup and a side salad with chicken for around $10.

My drink was good. Wasn't hungry so just ordered pub fries. They were given to me within minutes of ordering so basically I got someone's screw up order because they weren't even hot. What a joke will go somewhere just because I didn't have my husband with me. I didn't order enough for them to care
Typical chainish spot with a few unique items like mac and cheese pizza and pretzel brat/ burger. Just add exercise!!!!

3.5 stars...
Yelp came through again!!!
Ordered the cheese curds, and they were the best I've ever had! Served with a hatch chile ranch which complemented the tender batter and salty cheese.
For lunch I had the chimmichurrie steak salad. Cool greens balanced the spicy dressing and steak chunks. Avocado, corn, black beans, and tortilla strips all worked well together. The portion was so large I had no room for dessert..
Prices are in line with expectation and ambiance is standard outdoor patio.
This joint makes the list, I'll come back and likely order the same items all over again, but next time save room for dessert!!!
Hostess was a bit rude, waitress was pleasant. Beer is sort of flat. Limited menu on Sundays.
Neat bar/brewpub right by the state Capital building. Really nice beer selection, tons of house brews to sample. Very fun visit!

Great food. Great beer. I have never thought twice about coming here during the week.  Have not had the fish fry so I can't comment there. Super menu with so many tasty treats to choose from. Can honestly say that I've never been disappointed by the food. On the other hand, I will admit that the service can lag a little at times.

The service was a little less subservient than I prefer, but can't argue with the potato/leek/bacon soup.  And in WI, it's safe to assume cheddar is included.  Yummy - with some kind of cinnamon vodka drink, served in error with no apology or discount.  Who cares, it was all tasty and the back bar redolent of yesteryear with big leatheresque booths surrounding our chubby cherubic happy selves.  Gotta love smug, fat, happy WI.  Go big red...we know how to eat!

Great Beer & Great Food. 
The Beer is really good, some of the best beer I've ever had !! "Jamaican Jerk" The best wings I had in Madison.

So the place looks awesome from the outside....great selection of beer and the atmosphere is cozy and lively. On the downside, I've had their food several times and to me its just ok, nothing to write home about or even here. It just tastes ok or glorified bar food. It could be what I had to eat. It's not just this one, I've been to another and had the same impression.

I had the Texarkana Burger.  It was meh.  The atmosphere is great here.  It is in a great location near the mall.  The food was above average price and it wasn't that good.  We really have nothing special to say about it.  I was hoping for so much more and we left disappointed.

Recently visited Madison after 15 years away. I was shocked to see how the city and Hilldale had changed -- for the better, it seems. Back in the day, I remember a lonely Chinese restaurant and a Quiznos as the only food choices at Hilldale. We were there in September. Not sure how all the outdoor activity changes during Madison's frigid months. I'll let the city planners worry about that. The fay were were there, the while place was buzzing with crowds.

I believe Great Dane had opened its first location right before we left Madtown. This was our first visit. The menu provides some humorous nods to Madison culture. We appreciated that.

We were seated at a table by the window for optimal people watching. I ordered a salad and some decadent soup -- potato, bacon and cheese. On the plate was an absolutely lovely pretzel roll, which I devoured. My husband had a couple ales and a sandwich. He was feeling no pain by the time we left. I am not a beer drinker, so I stuck with iced tea, liberally refilled by our waitress.

Overall we had a positive experience. Recommended.

I really enjoy The Great Dane! I especially enjoy the Hildale location, although the Fitchburg location is where my husband and I had our first date many years ago. Last night we attended the NYE event at the Hildale location. We had a really lovely time. There was only a five dollar cover charge and the band was fun. My burger was well cooked and very tasty. My favorite new discovery is the 
Stone of the Scone Scottish Ale. Our waiter was friendly but not constantly in our face. It was great to see folks of all ages out having a good time. The Great Dane Hildale put on a great party at a reasonable price. Good service and good food!

Love this place (and it's not all about the beer). 

It might be packed with people, but there are a lot of tables and booths, and hopefully you won't have to wait (we didn't). The menus are super cute--like a small newspaper--and fairly extensive. There were two salads that looked so enticing and a couple of entrees that I wanted, but I eventually ordered the chicken pot pie! 

But first the beer... I usually don't order beer because I have a very limited number of beers that I'll drink (Guinness--ONLY in the U.K., coffee stout--ONLY in Alaska), so I'm picky! Thankfully you could have as many free samples as needed, but after trying the Emerald Isle Stout (along with a porter that I forgot the name), I ordered the 12 ounce Stout. If you like beer or are like me with a limited group of "likes," I'm guessing you can find the right one here!

Back to the food. The chicken pot pie has only the top as pie crust, as the bottom is a pot. Inside the chicken pieces are plentiful, the veggies are good, and the cream sauce is excellent! It came with a pretzel stick, but after a bite, I handed it off to the hubby. It tasted fine, but I didn't need it, as my entree also came with "applesauce," which was really baked apple slices and a little sprinkle of cinnamon. So yummy! I counted that as dessert, so my meal was complete and excellent!

Service was excellent. We actually had two people attending our table, as one was in training, and this was no problem.

Great experience!

With the space for two bar areas and several dining rooms, this location is a decent option for groups. They also have a pool table, shuffleboard, and darts without a lot of crowding in order to play.

The bars are generally efficient, and the service is adequate though not exceptional. The menu is decent although I'd like to see it expand a bit more. The food is filling and tasty on the higher end of a bar menu. The appetizers and mac and cheese tend to be my favorites.

My only real downfall here is the parking situation. Hilldale has not figured this out, which is unfortunate. If you park in the ramp you cannot leave any vehicles overnight. I find this discouraging as this area now has several bars/restaurants serving alcohol and should be more accommodating for safe options. The other options are risking a ticket in the bank or hardware store lots, or parking back by Sundance Theater or University Bookstore (which is my usual go-to) for less hassle.

Great place to stop for happy hour on your way home from work.  They have a great beer selection, and a nice menu.  We've never been displeased with the food.  The atmosphere is fun - they opened up the back area - which looks REALLY great.  
The service has always been lacking.  The waitstaff don't seem to care - and we've had several rude staff over the years.

This is a great place to go for drinks with friends and appetizers. I've been here many times for just that and it would get an extra star if just that.

However, they also have many dishes and a pretty large weekend brunch buffet. The buffet had it's highs and lows, but the one thing that stood out to me, was the ranch dressing.

FYI, if going to brunch, it's great for groups. They have a salad bar, complete with shrimp, fruit/yogurt and a nacho section. They have an omelet station and prime rib. They had pancakes, french toast, ribs, pasta's, mango chicken, cheesy potatoes, vegetables and stuffing. There was variety. Hopefully knowing this helps. Oh.. and we really liked the wings. Especially when paired with the ranch.

Overall, it's not bad, but it's not great. I think it would be ideal for large groups or if you want to have drinks with friends. Most locations have pool tables, dart boards and shuffle boards.

It couldn't get much worse.1t is almost laughable. Server claims that u could not order off regular menu even though we arrived at 10:45. Late might menu kicks in at 11Pm. He gave us water then disappeared for 10 minutes .when we asked to order he told us we could not off regular menu. What an idiot. Where's the manager when u need one??

Wide variety of food; had one of the new Oktoberfest specials - curry brat over fries with pickled peppers. Balanced flavor. Also it has good booth seating. Game day snacks / specials. Was family friendly or date friendly.

Visited to celebrate Father's Day with my dad, brother and his girlfriend and my son. Our server, Nancy, was outstanding and the food was amazing! Not to mention the excellent beer. Would recommend it to anyone who wants a good drink and some great food.

Checked this place out during a Badgers game. Good atmosphere and not too busy and crowded. The wings were excellent. Tomato soup a bit salty. Fish and chips solid and their seasonal Bavarian chicken sandwich was also solid. They have a good array of drinks on tap. Service was great. Place clean. There's also a quieter area too if you want brewery without loudness from the game. What you expect from a good pub & brewery.
Over priced for mediocre burgers and uninteresting entrees. I would only go here for convenience or to not offend a conservative pallet.

This was my second time in Madison, and my second time at the Great Dane.  I've never been disappointed, and this time remembered to try one of their many beers.  
First the beer-  I went for their wheat, and it was delicious-  just a great flavor without being too hoppy or too heavy.   For my meal, I went for the buffalo mac and cheese-  it came with grilled chicken and a pretzel roll.  It had just the right amount of kick, and the mac and cheese was delicious, just what I expect from Wisconsin!  I also had had a brat, and that too was great.  Add in a friendly and attentive server, and it was a great meal.

I enjoy going to the Great Dane and I love the large open space of the back bar area.  I was recently there for a Sunday brunch with a group of friends.  They take reservations and the waiter was chill with us arriving and leaving in shifts.  Since the brunch was a buffet style we could get up and get what we needed as we needed.  The waiter was still attentive with our drinks and the fact that we all had separate bills.  I recommend the tables in the back bar area over the booths and the "loft" area in the back is great for slightly larger gatherings like birthday gatherings.  Don't forget to arrive in time to park if you are meeting people as street spots are limited as well as the parking lot across the street.  The ramp is usually the fastest and best bet.

We came here last March on our way to Milwaukee after a night in Middleton. As craft beer enthusiasts and fans of the dog breed, it was only proper to stop in and check it out.

There's a handful of Great Danes in the Madison area. As a Chicago suburbanite, Great Dane reminds me of Rock Bottom restaurants, only the Danes have both a larger selection of beer and food, plus Sunday brunches. Oh, and they're cleaner, brighter, and bigger (as least the Hilldale location is). I wish we had Great Danes instead of Rock Bottom!

We tried a handful of beers, including:

Peck's Pilsner (5.36%) - A nice, light Pilsner, this beer is a good one to start with. I stuck with a taste rather than a full pour.

Crop Circle Wheat (4.99%) - This Hefeweizen is a fabulous German brew garnished with a slice of lemon. It definitely hits the spot on an warm, early spring day. This was one of my favorites we tried. 

High Tea (4.5%) - An English Mild Ale. I thought it was just alright; there's some slight roasted flavors that makes this an easy drinker if you don't feel like venturing onto the darker, heavier side of beer.

Kelheim Bock (6.4%) - Malty but smooth. 

Black Earth Porter (5.83%) - This was our favorite beer. The taste of chocolate and coffee is prominent; there's no shortage of flavor here!

As typical with brewery visits, we picked up shirts and a growler. I also bought a pint glass with their logo on it, because you can never have too many pint glasses, and this has a Great Dane on it (and we love Danes!). 

We did not get to try any of the food as we had eaten on the stop previous to this, but their menu is intriguing and I would certainly try some items in the future.

The restaurant is clean and inviting; the bartenders were friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. Parking wasn't too bad on a Sunday morning at around 11 a.m.; we were able to park easily right on Price Place.

We'll definitely be back the next time we do a weekend jaunt in the 608!

Love the beer.  Love the food.

This is a nice, large location.  I found the service to be very friendly and attentive to our needs.  I've always loved the food Great Dane shells out.  I had the brat/burger thing - it was decadent...  

Of course, the beer is fantastic.  Try 'em all!

It's the Madison version of your typical local giant pub, it brews its own beers which are fine but not amazing, makes its own sodas, and has a massive menu. There's everything from burgers to random falafel or tandoori chicken. And of course cheese curds. They come with ranch but the waiter had no problem bringing us some bbq sauce. The Mac and cheese with chicken was good, but the sauce was more liquidy than really cheesy. The buffalo sauce in it was good. My friend said the tandoori chicken and falafel are some of his favorites. The burgers are also good. The ginger ale was decent, different from Schweppes or whatever, but not as flavorfufl as I'd like, and a pint was a lot. the root beer was also decent. The service was good, friendly, and quick. There's plenty of parking. As my friend aid, it won't be the best meal you've ever had, but nothing will be bad.
nice place.  came here to celebrate a friends birthday.  they charged us for bringing our own cake.  not nice for a group of med students.  no parties here again

was at the eastside  place on Jupiter--group of 12-place was empty-had the total upstairs--just walked in from Chicago--had an IPA--not much good, but,like pizza--fresh homemade is never that bad--$5.50 for Imperial pint-- 

Had the tuna salad--weak--thought that peak Wisconsin produce would be killin it--but not there--freezer fries--overall nothing good

This Great Dane Hilldale location is in my neighborhood.  It is a reliable choice when meeting a group of friends before a movie or just for a few drinks.  The staff is usually spot on professional and friendly.  

My usual order is the James Madison (half sandwich and bowl of soup) with the Cuban and the West African Chicken Peanut Stew.  So flavorful and tasty.  There is nothing better on a cold day then this stew.  They do make great burgers, too.  And I can not complain about their starters.

But one of the best reasons to go is for the Beer.  I enjoy trying all their styles.

I support the Great Dane in large part because of their support for MUFA (Madison Ultimate Frisbee Association).  They give a tremendous amount of resources and space to the thousands of Frisbee players who show up after games all summer long.
I am actually not a fan of their beer...I always get the Scotch Ale which I enjoy...but have left with a major headache when trying more then one in a night.
Their food however is fabulous.  I highly recommend the nachos with chicken or 20 piece chicken wings.  I was also pleasantly surprised by their fish fry.

I'm going to reiterate what other reviewers have said previously. The service is completely lacking here. The servers - while friendly - take an exorbitant amount of time to come to your table. The kitchen - while making incredibly tasty food - is unacceptably slow. And the price you pay for both is just far too much for what you get. 

As for kid/family friendly, I would try somewhere else or get carry out. This place is a brewpub that tries to be good for families, but in the end it's still just a bar.

Tasty food but not enough to make up for the other detractors.

Have great starters to share with friends, and also great beer. Would be even better if they had large screens for sport games.
They have brunch buffet on Sunday mornings. I like their salad bar which has shrimp and salmon. There's also fresh-made omelette which you can choose for your own ingredients.

As a frequent guest at the Great Dane, I'd say that usually I have a good time here.  This past Saturday, I attended post badger game for the Dane's $2 drafts. I started to get hungry and ordered the cheese/artichoke dip. It was absolutely terrible,  the bread bowl it came out in was cold hard bread and the dip might as well been cream of chicken soup with large chunks of artichoke. Not much of a dip. For $10, I expected much better than the top of the bread bowl (which was also hard and cold) and a few sticks of celery/carrots.   No one at my table would even try it, it looked so unappetizing and I couldn't blame them.

So great. Food was hot and delicious, wait staff was prompt and gave recommendations when I was indecisive. Cheese curds we're out of this world. I ordered a grilled cheese and their peanut stew, was savory and had the right amount of oomph to it. Husband ordered the fried fish which was amazing. the fish was fresh and melted in your mouth. Would go again. Pricing was reasonable.

I have been here many times, and love their french onion soup and mac n' cheese.  Also, being a vegetarian, I love the option to change any of their burger patties out with a veggie patty, and their veggie patty is pretty darn good.  They also have delicious bloody mary's and salads as well.  However, it's a tad overpriced for the amount you get.  I'm not that big of a beer drinker, so their extensive/awesome beer selection of their own beers doesn't really appeal to me.  I will definitely continue to go back, just not often so I can save up again during visits ;)

IT IS OFFICIAL.... I HAVE AN OVER-EATING PROBLEM

Before we get to the light bulb point, let's step back and set the scene.

I'd been recommended this place by some colleagues who have been to Madison a lot for work. We looked it up and found there were a few locations for the group so we picked here as it was closer to Verona where we were staying and we thought we'd be able to park easier than near the capital (we were right there was a free car lot across the street).

We walk in and its packed! Thursday night and we were told it would be a 60min wait for a table for 2! But they said if we could find room at the bar or the high top tables we could just sit. So we hovered and almost left but I was thinking if it's this busy we really have to try it! We got super lucky and found a high top table and were set. We got our hands on the menu which was in the style of an old newspaper (cool!) and the menu was huge! We struggled to pick.... until I saw the fried chicken with shrimp, andoille sausage, artichoke and mushrooms with a side of mashed potatoes and jalapenos and seasonal veggies ... with a name like smothered and covered fried chicken it pretty much sums up an almost perfect meal for me.... sold! As I was ordering I was telling myself.. diet start tomorrow, diet starts tomorrow... salad only for the next week!

Food arrives... of course as expected large serve... and it is great. Chicken is crunchy fried and the toppings work well and the jalapeno mashed potatoes are great... a really nice spice that went well with the chicken.

Now to the official fatso moment.... the waitress comes over and sees my empty plate... it must not be a common occurrence as she looks over and audibly says "wow" and gives me a HIGH FIVE!... oh the shame... Diet starts tomorrow, diet starts tomorrow.

I've said it before and I'll say it again, dam you America and your delicious food!!!!!!!!

I am giving 5 stars for the tuna tataki off the appetizer menu and the african peanut stew. Favorites off this menu.  Everything else tried here has always been good!  Love their variety of brews but they also have a nice selection of wine.  Pretty crowded before movie time on Friday nights, but you can get a quick bite at the bar or the bar top tables without waiting....if you find a seat.

The Great Dane is always a good choice for dinner! They're meals are tasty, the venue is nice, the service is usually very good and the price is fair. It's always less busy when you come for lunch rather than dinner, but even during dinner hours, during the week you shouldn't have a problem just showing up without a reservation. 
The chicken pot pie is my favorite menu item! It comes with a pretzel bun and a delicious side of cooked cinnamon apples (which I use as dessert!)  All of this is only $10-$11, what a deal!

This is not the best Dane in the Madison area but the closest, most convenient one for us.

Service is always so-so and the food quality just seems to get worse and worse every time we come. We usually get an order if poutine which is one of my favorite dishes in general. Theirs is ok, nothing special but good enough. They Asian tuna salad is also pretty tasty. The meatloaf also isn't bad or their burgers but like I said quality that we have expected from a Great Dane Restaurant just isn't there anymore.

Their beer is good and we will sometime stop here for just that but every time we pass the Dane now my husband and I just kinda make a face and choose another spot to dine. There are a lot of other choices now for quality American cuisine that the Dane is rarely in our rotation anymore.
Beer is delicious, pretzel is delicious, I haven't had the best experience with entrees. I've tried 2 entrees there and both times they were just okay. The service has always been great though.

We found this place from asking a clerk at the hotel. It was a bit difficult to get to but it was well worth it. The food was very good and they even made substitutions when requested. It was very loud and the drinks weren't refilled very quickly. For those reasons, it didn't get a five. But, if you are in the area, it is a good place to go!

Great location, atmosphere, and prices.  The food is hit or miss though, depending on what you get.  The most disappointing though is the staff.  Most of the times I've been there I have always felt that I was burden or they were too busy to serve me.  Still, I would recommend based on beer selection.
We sat outside which was very nice. The food  was good. I had a wrap and my friend had chicken salad. Sweet potato fries were yummy and the service was also good.
Food and beer were delicious. Service was friendly and professional. We ate downstairs, very cool environment.

This place can be packed, and you may very well wait 45 minutes for a table some nights. The hosts and hostesses are friendly, and the servers provide good service, in general. Although, I'm not usually "wow-ed" when I come to Great Dane. 

The fried fish that goes into the fish tacos is mediocre. The BBQ "salsa" for that dish is also a bit odd. The salmon burger is always a winner, though, and the caper aioli is really tasty. I understand this is a place that brews their own beer, but I didn't expect the cocktail menu to be essentially non-existent and for the moscow mule to be just "eh" that I took baby sips from the whole meal. The one appetizer that does wow me here is the Mediterranean plate.

I think this place is a staple, both the Hilldale and downtown locations, in Madison because it is always decent and has a good selection. I wouldn't go out of my way necessarily to eat at the Dane, but it's always a convenient option when I'm near Hilldale or seeing a show downtown and wanting to grab food and a drink beforehand.

The parking is a bit weird here too. The spots to the west of the restaurant state that it's reserved for the bank, but that leaves a few street parking spots and the parking garage. I've parked in the lot almost every time and never had any issues with getting a ticket...

We went out at 12:30 to get lunch and watch the Steelers game.  We were so happily surprised with how great of a deal the brunch buffet was and how good it was!  Kids 4 and under, so all three of my kids, eat the brunch free!  SCORE!  

The kids and I went to the buffet approximately 17 times.  They ate SO much!  Pancakes, french toast, cheesy hash browns, tacos, sausage, bacon, eggs, fruit, yogurt, omelette station, carving station, tacos, waffles, salad bar, and ice cream sundae station.  The food was awesome, extensive beer list selection (their home brewed wheat beer was really good), and quick service.

We were able to get our game on one TV even during the Bears Packers game, and we will definitely be back to try their regular menu!
Careful going on a Sunday before 2 they only serve the late night  menu and a way too expensive buffet.

This place was packed and looked fun. However, we ended up being disappointed. We asked and were seated outside. The table was not very nice and covered with bird poop. Also, we were sitting right next to all the utilities under the stairs and it smelled / gross. So, we moved up to the bar. The bar was very dirty but we finally got it cleaned. There were 2 ladies running the bar and were very rude. They kept apologizing for their behavior saying that it is busy. As a customer, I would expect good service. We did flights and they were so impatient with us when picking what we wanted. We ate at the bar and waited a very long time. The food was sub par bar food.

Stopped in for a late lunch, and thoroughly enjoyed our burgers. Everything was flavorful, prepared exactly how I requested. The portions weren't too big, either. I also loved my garlic mashed potatoes. Staff quite friendly, too.
